fields.description:
h2. Issue Summary
When users are Editing Pages in Confluence, they often get an error message in the top right corner of the screen with a message that says: _Can't sync with the server. Refresh the page to try to re-establish the connection._

If they click on the close button within the error message frame, the Publish button becomes grey and unusable. If they refresh the editor, they often get the same problem again. They then keep refreshing until the problem eventually goes away.

h4. Screenshot of the Error
!Screen Shot 2018-12-20 at 16.21.31.png|thumbnail!

h2. User Feedback
_He can click on Edit and get into Edit mode. However, 2 problems occur periodically: (1) error: "can't sync with the server." and, when he X's out of that message, he is unable to edit the page even though it is in Edit mode or (2) he's able to edit the page but unable to click the Publish button. When he was experiencing this, the problem persisted for about 2 hours until he was able to successfully edit and publish the page in question._

h2. Steps to Replicate
This error happens randomly and the steps to replicate it are unknown at this time.
fields.summary: Confluence - Can't Sync with the Server

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
No submit button on support.atlassian.com when selecting Questions for Confluence under product Marketplace Apps, see the attached screenshot.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud
* Marketplace Apps
* Questions for Confluence

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to support.atlassian.com
# Select *Technical Issues and Bugs* under *What can we help you with?*
# Then select *Marketplace Apps* under *Which product is this for?*
# And select *Questions for Confluence* under *Which Marketplace app?*

h3. Expected Results
There should be a submit button or something which should tell the next step.


h3. Actual Results
No submit button appears
 
h3. Notes
The customer can create ticket related to Questions for Confluence by selecting Confluence as a product in spite of Marketplace Apps but the point is why this option is even given if it takes to nothing.

h3. Workaround
The customer can create ticket related to Questions for Confluence by selecting Confluence as a product in spite of Marketplace Apps
fields.summary: No submit button on support.atlassian.com when selecting Questions for Confluence under product Marketplace Apps

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the top page pf Questions for Confluence
# Set IME to Japanese one

 e.g.) Type "k"(Consonant) + "i"(Vowel).

"き" will be entered in the search box

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the current Cloud release for Confluence, the @mention feature will list all users from the instance

h3. Suggested Solution
Confluence should add another option or layer of permission so that the @mention result will only display the result based on the users group membership. e.g User is a member of groups ABC and CDE, @mention should only display users from group ABC & CDE only.

h3. Why this is important
This restriction would be beneficial if customer has rules or policy that they need to obliged
fields.summary: Restrict @mention based on user's group membership

fields.description:
Prior to the redesign the bottom bar comfortably housed all the necessary actions, including the Preview button. This button is arguably the most important button in the GUI, as the WYSIWYG editor doesn't always produce the desired results.

On a personal level, I would say that the people who came up with the new button placement, approved it, and implemented it never ever used Confluence for any extended period of time. It's a change for the change's sake, as I can't imagine anyone look at the ~1500px of empty horizontal space and say: "it's not enough to place three or four buttons there. Let's only show two and hide the other two behind a drop-down menu".

Even if you argue for a mobile look, hardly anyone edits Confluence pages on the mobile. And even if they do, there' s plenty of space even in the mobile view if you remove/shorten the otherwise unnecessarily long "Latest changes have been saved".

 

Original Tweet: "I do realize that there's just not too much space at the bottom of the screen, but perhaps, just perhaps, hear me out, you could possibly *not* hide the extremely useful "preview" button in a totally useless two-item menu?" ([https://twitter.com/dmitriid/statuses/1076027320316674048]))
fields.summary: Unhide Preview Button

fields.description:
The gallery macro will be removed as announced in: [We're cleaning up the macro browser|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/we-re-cleaning-up-the-macro-browser-946028471.html]

The page suggests that people insert images directly as an alternative, but as per customers feedback, this is in no way an alternative as this macro is used to display dynamic pages of images from a library based on labels. 

This is a macro that is not obsolete, it's one that needs fixing so it works as it used to (i.e. you could click on the image to download it) known issue reported in the CONFCLOUD-57288-Gallery macro with style macro makes the preview on gallery macro is not working.

On *Confluence Questions* once you click the *Ask a Question* button, it places the cursor in the Description field.
As an UX improvement suggestion, it should place the cursor in the Title, since it is a required field and comes before the description field.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to create a new page through the "+" icon or using the *Decision* template button from the [Decision Log template|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/decision-template-937893638.html] the same will open the editor, but, will have a message stating that the changes cannot be saved, hence, avoiding the page to be published.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Tap the *+* icon from the sidebar, then, select the *Decision template* or try to create the Decision, using the [create from template macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/create-from-template-macro-724765187.html].
# Try to edit or publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The user should be able to publish the content on the page.

h3. Actual Results
A message with "(!) Can't Save Changes" is displayed and the publish option does not work:

!decision.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Refresh the draft/editor with the template and the message should be gone, allowing the user to publish the content.
fields.summary: Creating Decisions from template does not work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
1. When we delete a page in hello.atlassian.net, there is a message which displays '0 incoming links', but the page has incoming links.
2. This can also be checked by checking the *page information*, there will be no section for incoming links.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two pages ex: *Page A* and *Page B*;
# Copy and paste the link of *Page A* in *Page B*;
# Edit the text link from the page you inserted - let it as *Just a page*, for example;
# Publish the page;
# Go to the *Page A > ellipses > Page Information*.

h3. Expected Results
*Page A* should show *Page B* in Incoming links section, on *Page Information*, or when deleting this page.

h3. Actual Results
The Incoming links section is missing on Page Infomation of *Page B*.

h3. Workaround
Instead of changing the text link, let the original text that appears right after inserting the page link by re-inserting the link - then, it will show as an incoming link in the linked page.
fields.summary: 0 incoming links message while deleting a page even when the page has incoming link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using attachment macro, and under page title, we call a source page where there is a list of files in attachment macro. 
When editing those files (not from source page), you are able to edit it but the changes do not get saved in the page.
The only to edit the file is to edit the files from the source page and the changes will be reflected and the pages that call out that source page.

Source : 

Pages that use the page as a source list of file.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a master page
 # Add the attachment macro
# Publish the page
# add 2 files in the attachment macro
# Create another page (child)
# Add the attachment macro and under page title . add the master page title
# Publish the page.
# In the child page, edit one of the files and save it.

h3. Expected Results
The file gets edited and a new version is created
OR a message would pop out that along the line "This is not the source file, please proceed to source page to edit the file"

h3. Actual Results
It does get save without any error message.
However, the file does not save the changes and there is no version created.


(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround
Edit the file in source page
fields.summary: No change when editing a file in an attachment macro list that is not source of page.

fields.description:
h4.Summary
XML backup fails when generating site backup using backup manager and error message below prompt on the screen.

Export error

Export in progress - not responding
But don't worry, we'll fix it for you!
You just need to contact Atlassian support and paste in this error message, timestamp and your instance details.
Timestamp: 2018-12-02T07:16:06.662


h4.How to Replicate
# Go to Backup Manager in confluence and generate a backup
# Choose Backup and with or without attachments checked
# The backup spining in a while and the error message prompt out.
# Looking at the logs, it seems like Confluence is not able to write the exportDescriptor file

h4.Expected Result
Site backup successfully generated.

h4.Actual Results
Backup finish with export error

"Export in progress - not responding/ Unexpected error during export has occurred"

h4.Notes
This particular bug happens when there is at least one user with an invalid email address (like test@example.com) present on Confluence's cwd_user table as well as with a null entry in the enternal_id column.


h4.Workaround
No workaround currently

fields.description:
h3. Summary
New page drawer affects UX for keyboard-only users

h3. Description
With the new page drawer, it isn't possible to create a new page hitting *C* + *Enter* just one time.
When you hit *C*, the context changes and you have to hit *TAB* three times, then hit *Enter* to create a new page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a Confluence site with the new page drawer in the sidebar, hit *C* to create a new page
# Press *Enter*

h3. Expected Results
A new page would be created

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens. 

h3. Workaround
# Hit *C*,
# Hit *TAB* three times
# Then hit *Enter* to create a new page
fields.summary: New page drawer affects UX for keyboard-only users

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update 15 December 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
Hi - I’m a Divya Sriram, a PM on the Confluence team. I recognize that it's been a while since you've heard from the team, so I'm here with the update we owe you.

Solving the need for attachment links is high on our priority list. Currently, we are focused on critical work to improve table formatting and performance for Confluence Cloud pages  - problems that also affect a very broad pool of users.

Even though the solution to attachment links seems simple, there are a few technical considerations we need to tackle. We're actively investigating the best solutions to those problems and hope to start working on this in the next 6 - 9 months. We acknowledge that the delay on implementing this feature is frustrating for many of you. We will keep you updated on our progress.

If you want to chat live, please grab time with me here: [Divya Calendly Link | http://example.com]

{panel}

{panel:title=Status Update 3 December 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
Hi all!
 
My name’s Jonno and I’m a PM on the Atlassian Editor in cloud. This is an update on the status of this ticket/request.
 
This ticket alludes to a number of different features:
 # Being able to view an attachment inline vs having a thumbnail that takes up an entire line.
 # Being able to link to an attachment that exists elsewhere in Confluence.

We have a roadmap item in Q3 (Jan - March) to start work on the first problem - being able to view an attachment inline vs having a thumbnail that takes up an entire line. *To be clear - this item will also include the missing ability to insert an already present image within the attachments of the specific page.*

We do not yet have roadmap work assigned to the second problem - being able to link to an attachment that exists elsewhere in Confluence. We are, however, exploring what we could do in this area. 

I’ll continue to update this ticket as I have more to share.
 
If you ever want to have a chat in person about the new editing experience, my calendar is always open to book in a 1:1 Zoom call - [https://calendly.com/jkatahanas/editor|https://calendly.com/jkatahanas/editor?month=2020-12].
 
Please keep the feedback coming 🙂 
 
Cheers,
 
Jonno | PM for the Atlassian Editor (Cloud)
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

With the latest [editing improvements|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html], the ability to display an attachment file as a link has been removed from the Link Macro. It is now only possible to link to known pages with this macro. 

Displaying a link to an attachment in a page is only possible by attaching it using a macro directly or as a preview.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide ability to link text to attachments using the Link macro. 
h3. Workaround

By using the [Attachments macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/attachments-macro-724765160.html], you can obtain the URL of an attachment and link text to that by pasting the link into the Link Macro.
h3. Workaround 2

By visiting the `Attachments` page through the `•••` menu, you can right-click on the attachment links and `copy link address`. Then use that as a text/blue link.
fields.summary: Ability to link text to an attachment in editor

fields.description:
h2. Issue Summary
Confluence can throw an error message in its right upper screen corner when folks using Collaborative Editing tries to Publish a change in their pages. The error message reads as: *Unable to communicate with server. Saving is not possible at the moment.* or *There was an error processing the request.*

h4. Screenshot of the Error
!Screen Shot 2018-12-20 at 15.59.09.png|thumbnail!

h2. Steps to Replicate
The error appears randomly, but, it has already been proved that it can happen due to macros, such as the Status Macro, for example. One should be able to replicate it by doing the following:
# Create a page and include some Status Macros.
# Have more than one person editing the page at the same time.
# Hit Publish - You shall run into the problem.
fields.summary: Confluence - Unable to communicate with server Error

h3. Summary
While using the [Application Navigator|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/creating-links-in-the-application-navigator-945104646.html] in order to access a Confluence application from Jira (or simply tapping the button while in Confluence), the same will face intermittent issues to be loaded. 

Note that this *does not happen* frequently, but, eventually if the user taps the navigator button, the reloading issue will start.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Tap the *application navigator* icon and select *Confluence*

Confluence should properly load.

h3. Actual Results
Confluence keeps spinning and no information is rendered.

h3.Workaround
* Manually refresh the page/open in a new tab.
* Resize the browser.
* Clearing the cache also helps

fields.description:
For pages created with a template, it would be useful to have a way to apply some kind of format with automatic numbering to the page title. 

For example, we can have a page template that allows automatic incremental numbers on a page title. For instance, a meeting notes that have the default format (Stand- NNN). It would be definitely useful for the users to have the ability to create auto-generated formatting starting from (Standard - 001) that will allow the number from the page title to increments every time when creating the meeting notes as the meetings notes were created on a daily basis. 

Features that has been discussed on:

https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/Is-it-possible-to-auto-generate-number-in-confluence-5-7/qaq-p/220814
https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Answers-Developer-Questions/How-can-I-automatically-create-numbered-pages-with-confluence-e/qaq-p/563318
fields.summary: Automatic page title formatting from page template

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira's search rest end point returns back a "total" parameter for a query. This total is independent of the number of items that's returned in that request's payload. It's truly the total of the query.

This allows a developer to do real pagination. Ie. I can make a request with a request size of 25 and then get the first 25 items but sinceI then know that the total is 53 - I now have to make 2 more requests to get all of the other items.

With Confluence though - there is no total parameter. There is a size attribute which will return the number of items in that request. While I can use this to tell me if I should stop hunting for more pages (ie make the first request - get 25 items back, make the second request get 25 items back, make the third request - get 3 items back) - it's not as useful as the jira approach (and I can't preplan in my code how to pull things).

It would be awesome for the rest api for confluence to follow Jira's approach
fields.summary: Include total in response of search endpoint REST API

fields.description:

The text should be grey

h3. Actual Results
The text is set to blue:
|  !Screen Shot 2018-12-19 at 20.28.38.png|thumbnail! |

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a customer has modified the "Default Welcome Message" in Confluence, the main Confluence URL (https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki) does not render; if accessing the /wiki/discover/all-updates or /wiki/discover/popular pages, the sidebar and welcome message does not load

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Site Settings > Global Templates and Blueprints > Edit "Default Welcome Message" Template
# Make a single change or remove the Welcome Message altogether

h3. Expected Results
When navigating to Confluence Home, page loads without issues. 

h3. Actual Results
In all Browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari)
If visiting https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/, only a loading spinner appears:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 


If visiting https://instance.atlassian.netwiki/discover/all-updates (or /popular), Activity Feed loads but nothing else
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

No Errors appear in Dev Console

h3. Notes
- It does not seem to impact Space Sidebars, only the Dashboard
- Reproducible with an Empty Welcome Message


h3.Workaround
- Revert the "Welcome Message" to defaults (Users may need to clear their Browser's Cache/Cookies after it has been reverted) or
 - If the Welcome Message needs to be utilized, resizing the browser Window causes the Dashboard to load correctly
fields.summary: Confluence Dashboard Does Not Load if Custom Welcome Message is Used

We can't add your inline comment; the section you highlighted may contain a macro or user mention. Try highlighting plain text.

The comment should be added inside the panel information

h3. Actual Results
The following is displayed while testing:
!inline.png|thumbnail!

It did not happen with the older editor.

h3.Workaround
Comment at the bottom of the page.

fields.description:
Currently, Macros/add-ons that are not natively supported on mobile devices still show placeholder elements on a page. 

It would help the Mobile experience if these Macros/ add-ons could be prevented from rendering anything on the page, in order to not give a perceived inferior feel compared to the Desktop experience.
fields.summary: Allow disabling of unsupported macros in Mobile Application/ View

fields.description:
With the introduction of the fix for https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-11285, all   page URLs will use the page name but drop any non-standard characters ( letters with mutations, special characters, special Unicode characters).

However, the Heading links created by Macros such as the ToC Macro will produce links which properly encode and include said characters.

This behavior does not disrupt the functionality of Confluence but creates an inconsistent experience. It would be welcome if all URLs /links would use a consistent structure and encoding.
fields.summary: Create consistency in URL/ Link structure

fields.description:
With the [User profile macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-user-profile-macro/], users can retrieve profile information (picture, name, and email address)

h3.Suggestion

As a suggestion, having the macro retrieving additional profile information such as the ones from the [Atlassian account|https://support.atlassian.com/atlassian-account/docs/manage-your-personal-profile/] (I.E. location, job title) or even custom ones would be useful so the profile information could be viewed on a page instead of needing to access the user's profile at the People session.

This is a suggestion to allow the User profile macro to retrieve additional information for the user's profile.
fields.summary: Include additional information for 'User Profile Macro'

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a table in the new editor(or create a page using the Meeting Note blueprint)
# Click and drag the line between the columns to change the width of columns
 !スクリーンショット 2018-12-19 17.50.49.png|thumbnail! 
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The column width is changed as configured

h3. Actual Results
The column width will differ from the user configuration
 !スクリーンショット 2018-12-19 17.51.02.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Note

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If two users are editing the same page, one at the top and the other at the bottom of the page, the first user will be scrolled while the second user types.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new blog post or meeting notes (new editor)
# Share the link to another user to edit
# Insert a big quantity of text (enough to display a scroll bar) and keep typing at the bottom of the page
# ask the other user to try to type at the top of the page or scroll up

h3. Expected Results
The user typing at the top of the page shouldn't be affected by the other user.

h3. Actual Results
The first user will be scrolled while the second user types.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Scroll issue while collaborative editing on the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Cloud Customers who are using the Jira Issue Macro with a JQL Filter based on Username "was in" are noticing that the Username is being converted to an ID after it is saved

The JQL does not run as it appears to be invalid

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Page (or view an existing page) and add a Jira Issue Macro with a Username filter; ex: {{assignee was in (some.user)}}
!screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
# Insert the Macro and Publish the Page
# Edit the Page and Macro Again

h3. Expected Results
Macro shows the results


h3. Actual Results
When Viewing the page, the following message is shown:
{quote}JIRA project doesn't exist or you don't have permission to view it.

View these issues in JIRA{quote}

If the Macro is edited, a different error is shown
{quote}The JIRA server didn't understand your search query. If you entered JQL, please ensure that it's correctly formed. If you entered an issue key, ensure that it exists and you have permission to view it. Learn More{quote}
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Notes
The ID shown appears to be the User's Atlassian account ID
It only appear to be affecting the "was in" query, using assignee = some.user or assignee in (some.user) seems to work with the Atlassian account ID
assignee = ID
!screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
assignee in (ID)
 !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
If using "Was In" JQL, create and save the Filter in Jira; rather than specifying JQL in the Jira Issue Macro, use the saved filter; ex filter = "My Saved Filter"
fields.summary: Jira Issue Macro JQL Username is Changing and Breaking Search

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Create from Template macro does not display existing templates in instances with the new page drawer

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In an instance with the new page drawer, create a page
# In this page, add a *Create from Template* macro

h3. Expected Results
You are able to pick templates from a list

h3. Actual Results
The list does not load any templates
You can see a {{error {:type :server-error, :data {:type :jwt/unauthorized, :source :server}} error message in the browser's console.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
In Confluence, if the user does not have *space administrator* permission, the same will still be able to see the *Space Settings* button, which will allow the same to see options like the *Integrations* and *Space Settings*.

For some specific reasons, due to the integration with Slack, any user can integrate a space with a slack application and this can impact on the usability of the spaces. This is a suggestion to disable the *Space Settings* option for users that are not administrators of a specific space.
fields.summary: Hide "Space Settings" from non-space administrators

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the new editor we can't change the text color using Macbook Pro's touch bar colors. When we highlight the text and then use Macbook Pro's touch bar to select the color we would want the text to be, nothing happens. Actually the text selection is lost.
h3. Environment
Safari running on Macbook's Pro with touch bar.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use Safari
# Create or edit a page
# Highlight some text
# Use Macbook Pro's touch bar to select a color

h3. Expected Results
The highlighted text changes its color to the color we selected in the touch bar.
h3. Actual Results
The text color is not changed, and the text selection is lost.
 
h3. Notes

h3. Workaround
If the option to use the previous editor is still available, this is still working in the old editor.
fields.summary: Can't change text color using Mac's touch bar

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce

I'm not sure if it's 100% reproducible, but I observed the following:

1. I created several tasks on the page. Tasks were put in two cells in two columns in a table. I was in edit mode.
2. Another person clicked edit to have collaborative editing.
3. When another person clicked on a task to resolve it, I saw that two tasks were selected at once. That person saw only one task selected.
4. Deselecting/selecting again resulted in the exactly the same behaviour.

h3. Expected behaviour

When you mark task as done, only this task should be marked and not any other random one.
fields.summary: Clicking on one task during edit mode marks also another one

fields.description:
For a short while, test data accidentally got released into production code, so users that created a personal space in that time will have a home page that is auto generated with an extra "*(D M name)*" next to the about me section and an extra line with "*Email: jd@t.t*". 

The test data has been removed, but users that created a personal space starting on Dec 12th or Dec 13th that experienced this problem will have to manually edit the homepage and delete this test data.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On the new Create Page Drawer (sidebar), it's not possible to create a page from a template if this template contains variables.

h3. Environment
Confluence cloud with the new create page drawer (integrated with the sidebar).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a template with a variable
# Go to Confluence home and try to create a page from that template

h3. Expected Results
The editor should load and show the template contents to create a new page. In this case, it was suppose to show the form with variables to be filled. 

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens, the drawer just closes without any error in the console. 

h3. Workaround
# Create a normal page;
# Insert the "Create from Template" selecting the desired template;
# Save the page;

You'll be able to use this button to create that specific template.
fields.summary: Can't create page from template with variables on the New Drawer

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In Confluence, when the users click on the option to [insert a link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/insert-links-and-anchors-724764900.html] or [move a page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/move-copy-and-hide-pages-724764858.html] and then, select *Recently Viewed*, the recently viewed link wasn't shown on sequential order and the list wasn't updated accordingly to the recent view.

There is a bug which has been fixed on CONFCLOUD-63030 and this could be related to the issue.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create/edit a page in Confluence.
# While the editor is open, click on the *insert link* option from the editor menu. 
# Select the *Recently Viewed* option


h3. Expected Results
Outdated page sorted in random order

h3. Actual Results
Recently view page is shown on the list.



h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Recently Viewed show outdated link and wasn't in sequential order

fields.summary: Ability to create an RSS feed on an user

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Page Tree fails to load for unlicensed users
h3. Description

If a user without application access (active, unlicensed) is added to a group that should grant him access to a restricted page in a space open for *Any Active User*, the page tree in the sidebar will fail to load. It'll display the space's name and a little house icon in the side, and if it is clicked, it will start spinning and won't load any of its child pages. 
 It's possible to see a {{Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: Cannot read property 'children' of null}} error in the browser's console.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a instance with *Confluence Cloud* and *Jira Service Desk Cloud*, create a JSD project with a KB set in a Confluence Space
 # Update the JSD project setting to allow unlicensed users to read KB articles
 # Create a group in the User Management session, and add this group to the *View* permissions in that space
 # Restrict the space's homepage to be seen only by that group
 # Create a user without any application access, and add it to the group you've just created
 # Impersonate this user
 # Access the space, and click the space's name in the sidebar

h3. Expected Results

It should work as expected and load all of the child pages - if there are any
h3. Actual Results
 * No pages are loaded.
 * The sidebar keeps spinning/loading
 * A {{Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: Cannot read property 'children' of null}} error is seen in the browser's console.

h3. Notes

Sometimes, due to another bug, it may not happen. If you're impersonating a user, it could actually fetch the cached data in your profile.
 This seems to be happening consistently when actually logging with the user's profile in another browser/incognito window.
fields.summary: Page Tree fails to load for unlicensed users

fields.description:
This is a request for super _lightweight_ release/version tagging in Cloud, for those of us who are bound to authoring in a specific space (Jira Service Desk KB).

Page History needs to let authors flag certain versions as relating to a specific product release. I see two approaches:
 * *Version-specific _labels_*. Allow us to add labels to specific versions (better yet, have them distinguishable from regular labels). Do a search and get exactly the pages that changed for that version.
 * *Version-specific _names_*. Google Docs style, allow adding and listing page versions by custom name.

Phased implementation (as in, please do at least #1!): 
 # At first, please let us at least _capture_ the information!
 # Next, let us view _only_ the named/labeled versions.
 # Next, let us bulk-assign a version name to a set of active pages.
 # Finally, create a macro for a drop-down to select from any named versions on the page.
fields.summary: Page History needs version-specific labels or else tag/name (like gDoc)

fields.description:
While working with Confluence, the user has the option to [create Software Space from a template|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/create-a-space-from-a-template-827106195.html] and this will allow the newly created space to be linked with an existing project.

However, on multiple occasions, having the option to automatically create a project with a space could save much time and also, improve the integration as an additional feature between Confluence and Jira. This is a suggestion to allow the user to create a space and a new project from a default template.
fields.summary: Option to create space and project simultaneously

fields.description:
h3. Summary
With the recent [editing improvements|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html], when the user tries to create a new table, the formatting of the header row will not be applied to the *published* version. Specifically, the row is only used as a header while on edit mode. After publishing the page, the row does not have the text in bold (usually used in the headers, by default).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Meeting Note/Blog/page with the new editor
# Add a new table
# Make sure to add text to the header and *publish* the page

h3. Expected Results
The header should be using a bold font/match with the "editing" version of the same.
!edited.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
The text inside the newly created header row is displayed as a simple text/normal row text.
!published.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
* Recorded a video and attached to this case while reproducing the issue

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: "Header Row" not working in the new editor

fields.description:
By default, when [Confluence is integrated with Slack|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-cloud-for-slack-956709523.html], the same will allow notifications to be created for multiple functions, including pages and blog posts.

However, it would be really useful if the user could select to only have notifications when a Blog post is created and not include pages (and vice versa). This is a suggestion to allow the user to select notifications for Blogs or Pages only.
fields.summary: Granular Slack Notifications for Confluence Cloud (Blog Posts vs Pages)

We have hundreds of spaces and want to make an add-on available only to the relevant space.
fields.summary: Unable to restrict Atlassian connect add-on to a particular space

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Labels from Attachments are being displayed as if they belong to the page

h3. Description
If you add labels to an attachment and then add an *Attachments Macro* in the page where that file is attached, those labels will be displayed at the Labels modal, as if they belong to the page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page
# Add a file to that page
# Add an Attachments Macro
# Publish the page
# Go to *...* > *Attachments*, then, proceed to add a label to the file you've attached (e.g.: 'label123'
# Go to the page in view mode
# Check at the end of the page - no labels are displayed
# Now, click the pencil icon or hit *L*

h3. Expected Behavior
No labels should be displayed.

h3. Actual Behavior
The labels in the file(s) are displayed as if they were labels in the page
fields.summary: Labels from Attachments are being displayed as if they belong to the page

fields.description:
In Confluence, when a page is restricted, the user will have the option to tap the *Request Access* button in order to have a message sent to:

{quote}
# people who have contributed to the page in the past, can see the page and have 'Restrict' or 'Admin' space permission (sorted by last edit date)
# space administrators who can see the page (sorted alphabetically).
{quote}

In this case, if the person does not have permissions to change restrictions in the space, the request will be sent to an administrator that also has access to view the page, alphabetically. If a system add-on user (like Chat Notifications, for Slack) that has admin permissions has its name coming prior to the current admins in this list, the request will be sent to the same and the only way and this would block the user to proceed.

This is a suggestion to have Confluence skipping system users when looking to provide access to pages.
fields.summary: Ignore system user to grant page restrictions

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It would be beneficial to add a macro on a parent page that can provide the last date, time, and the username the parent page along with its child pages was modified. This way the administrator can track pages that have been created but was not recently updated or referenced. This is useful for organizations with large deployment to clean up their instances and keep them up-to-date.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a macro on the parent page that will provide the last updated date/time and username for that page and its child pages.

h3. Workaround
Using a database query, we can list all versions and modified dates of each page within a space:
{code:sql}
select s.spacename, c.title, c.lastmoddate
from content c
join spaces s on s.spaceid = c.spaceid
where contenttype = 'PAGE'
and prevver is null
and spacename = ‘<SPACENAME>';
{code}
* The {{<SPACENAME>}} must be replaced with the particular Space name in concern.
* If you want the information to be reported on a page, you can do so using a third-party plugin [Bob Swift's SQL for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/org.swift.confluence.sql/server/overview].
fields.summary: Macro to show information of last updated date/time and username for parent page and child pages

fields.description:

When editing a page, users cannot publish a pasted image from clipboard.

(on) This bug only affects the old editor.
h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Try to copy a small image with snipping tool
 # Edit the page and paste the image.
 # Click on Publish

h3. *Expected Results*

The image should be displayed on the published page.
h3. *Actual Results*

If the image small, you'll be able to publish, but you'll see a "broken image" on the view page.
 *OR*
 The image doesn't appear in the published mode, but is on the attachments.
h3. *Workaround*

If you use the *Insert files and images* macro to upload the image, it will work properly.
!image-2020-08-04-21-11-13-530.png|width=274,height=95!

fields.description:

# *Edit* the same by tapping the pencil in the top right

The font color should be matching the one from the editor (black).

h3. Actual Results
The default font color is using rgb(9, 30, 66), which is a darker blue.
h3. Notes
* It also affects heading texts
* rgb(51, 51, 51) and rgb(23, 43, 77) were also noticed.

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Default text color changed for published page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit the Meeting Notes template
## Confluence Settings > Global Templates and Blueprints > click Edit on Meeting Notes template
## Make a simple modification by adding text and save changes
# Create a New Space or use an existing Space
## Space Settings > Content Tools > Templates > click Edit on Meeting Notes template

h3. Expected Results
Space Admin is able to modify the Meeting Notes template for their Space

h3. Actual Results
No Errors in Browser console logs; just presented with a loading spinner: 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Notes
Users can create New Pages with the Modified Meeting Notes template and edit it as needed

h3.Workaround
Create the Meeting Notes from template and modify it as needed
fields.summary: Unable to Edit Modified Meeting Notes Template

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Similar to this older report, when trying to view the [Roadmap Planner macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/roadmap-planner-macro-724765275.html] on Firefox & MS Edge, the same will not provide options to see what's written in the bars.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have Firefox running and create a new page
 # Once editing the new page, insert the *Roadmap planner* macro (through Insert/+ > Other Macros > Roadmap Planner)
 # Make sure to edit the bars and include some custom text
 # Publish the page

h3. Environment
# Firefox
# MS Edge Version 18
# Roadmap Planner macro

h3. Expected Results

The text on the bars should be visible:
 !bar.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The bars are displayed without any text.
 !nbar.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Use Google Chrome.
fields.summary: Roadmap Planner bars not displaying text on Firefox

fields.description:
When a user [integrates Slack and Confluence|https://www.atlassian.com/blog/confluence/confluence-cloud-app-for-slack], the same will be able to receive multiple notifications for actions like edit, comment and adding a page. However, there are no integrations related to possible notifications about Team Calendars and its modifications.

This is a suggestion to add the ability to post Team Calendar changes to Slack Channels that are integrated with the application.
fields.summary: Synchronize Team Calendars with Slack Notifications for Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a video file is attached to the page, its thumbnail won't be immediately shown. If the page is published, the video fails to play.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Generate a video file
# Attach to the page (tested with drag and drop)
# Publish the page immediately after the upload finishes

h3. Expected Results
# The video's thumbnail should be rendered
# The video file should play

h3. Actual Results
The video thumbnail doesn't show and the video won't play on view mode with the following errors:
|  !Screen Shot 2018-12-10 at 17.07.00.png|thumbnail! |

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A small UI defect exists with Team Calendars and Confluence Cloud. The calendar arrows are different sizes, see screenshot.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud
* Team Calendars

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Visit a team calendar

h3. Expected Results
The arrows will be the same size

h3. Actual Results
The right arrow is slightly bigger than the left. 

 h3.Workaround
fields.summary: Team Calendar arrows are different sizes

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
Intermittent Performance issues for Confluence.


h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
No specific way to replicate, only the instance becomes slow Intermittently.

h3. *Environment*
This issue seems to be affecting mainly instances located in Europe.


h3. *Workaround*
None
fields.summary: Intermittent Performance issue for Confluence.

fields.description:
h3. The Issue
The users invited by the site-admin have an option to invite other users when they log in for the first time, and once the user sends the invitation to whoever was added by the newly created person, will receive an email address which states that the user who invited them (despite being a new user, and not an administrator), is an administrator. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Invite a new user
# Ask the user to invite someone

h3. Expected Behavior
This person will receive an email stating that it was invited to the instance

h3. Actual Behavior
This person will receive an email stating that it was invited to the instance by this user who is an administrator.
fields.summary: User Invitation Email Inconsistency

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When applying an inline comment to a line and then, editing a page and including a new line/bullet point below the one that already has a bullet point, the same will be applied to the text below, avoiding the user to be able to properly highlight the line.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence, create a new page and insert a simple line/bullet point
# Highlight the line and create a new *inline comment* on it
# *Edit* the page and add a second line/bullet point
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The inline comment should be only related to the first line/current line that was highlighted previously.

h3. Actual Results
The inline comment will be expanded to the lines below:
!inline1.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes

There is a video attached for the issue with bullet points:

 [^bulletpoint.mp4] 

h3.Workaround
No workaround found at the moment.
fields.summary: Inline comment applied to wrong text upon publishing

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a user clicks Request Access to a page which is restricted from them they will receive a message as below:
 !Screenshot 2018-12-07 at 4.31.40 PM.png|thumbnail! 

When they hover on the username, the message will overlap the user profile
 !Screenshot 2018-12-07 at 4.24.00 PM.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Steps to replicate
# Go to any restricted page
# Click access request
# Then hover your mouse on the username

h3. Observed behavior

The request message will overlap the profile


h3. Expected behavior

User should be able to see the profile
fields.summary: Page request message overlap user profile

fields.description:
h3. Summary

IE11 / Microsoft Edge users cannot download the Atlassian Companion from in-product because the modal window does not render correctly. The "Download for Windows" button is not available to click and the coloration of the modal window does not look correct.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Visit a page with an attachment macro in Internet Explorer 11 or Microsoft Edge
 # Click the Edit link for an attachment in the attachment macro
 # In the upper right of the preview window, click the "Edit with" dropdown

h3. Expected Results
"Download for Windows" button is prominent and available to click on

h3. Actual Results
Only the "Download for Mac" button is visible

h3. Notes
Some users are also facing this problem on other browsers on Windows.

h3. Workaround
Download the Atlassian Companion directly from the Release Notes page:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/atlassian-companion-app-release-notes-958455712.html
fields.summary: Companion download link for Windows missing on IE11 / Edge

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When exporting to an ICS / iCal file, most event types (Leaves, Birthdays, etc) in Team Calendars concatenate the "Who" and "Summary" Team Calendar fields into the SUMMARY field in the ICS file. The "Events" event type only includes the "What" Team Calendar field and not the "Who" field in the ics SUMMARY field. The "Who" field is required in the event types which put it in the ICS SUMMARY field, but is not required in the "Events" type.
h3.  Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an event of the "Events" event type
 # Include text in the "What" field for the event and users for the "Who" field
 # Subscribe to the calendar in Google Calendar or iCal, or download the ICS file and inspect it in a text editor

h3. Expected Results

Event in the ICS export shows "*Who: What*" in the SUMMARY field or as the description in a calendaring application
h3. Actual Results

Event shows "*What*" in the SUMMARY field
fields.summary: "Events" type does not export Who field into ICS summary

fields.description:
In the scenarios where a page/blog is shared with a user who is already a watcher, the user will get duplicate email notifications for the same event.

It would be good to de-duplicate these emails so that watchers get notified only once.
fields.summary: Prevent duplicate emails for content shared with a user who is already a watcher

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Some pages are not searchable due to index failure caused by their immense permission field.
h3. Expected Results

All pages are searchable for whom permitted.
h3. Actual Results

The warnings containing stacktrace like below occur:
{code:none}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Document contains at least one immense term in field=\"permissionSets_string\"
{code}

h3. Note

This issue is a root cause of CONFCLOUD-65098.
h3. Workaround

Reorganize page permissions not to contain too many permitted users/groups.
 [https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-configure-confluence-cloud-so-a-group-can-only-access-specific-spaces-780865465.html]
fields.summary: An immense permission field causes index unavailability

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using "diff" Syntax Highlighting on the code block, it wrongly highlights a new line after a "+" if there's no character at the "+" line

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert a Code Block macro;
# Select diff language
# Insert the text below:
{code}+ This should be highlighted
+ This too
+
This not
and this not{code}

h3. Expected Results
The text "This not" shouldn't be highlighted

h3. Actual Results
The new line is highlighted:
|  !Screen Shot 2018-12-06 at 18.42.31.png|width=900! |

h3. Workaround
Add a space character at the line with the "+"
fields.summary: Syntax Highlighting for diff language on the code macro is wrong

fields.description:
Is there function that allow users to drag files like PDF or word from confluence and drop it on Desktop? when i do that i get link to the attachment but i dont get the file it self. or to chose downloading path. 

also if there is a way to link Confluence attachments to Google drive, One Drive drop box. I know there are some pluggens that sync One and Google drive to confluence. I wonder if there is way to syn confluence Attachments to One eller Google drive.
fields.summary: Drag Drop from confluence to desktop

fields.description:
Hi team,

I think it would be useful to have an edit page button at the bottom of the page.

I find I am a the end of a page a lot and I want to edit but have to keep scrolling right up to the top to hit the edit icon. I think it would be more efficient if there was an edit button at the end as well. I would think a lot of users would find the same.

Thanks,

Noel
fields.summary: Edit Page Button - Bottom Page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, on the macro we only can configure the following:
{quote}
Restrict to this space key
Restrict to label(s)
Size
Placeholder text
Content type to include in search
Additional information
{quote}

Will be awesome if we can add the following option also:
{quote}
Language
Warning language
Hiding "advanced-cql-search-question-mark
{quote}
fields.summary: More option to configure LiveSearch Macro

fields.summary: Block frontend deployment: Can't edit inline comment

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If an image with certain resolution/ aspect ratio is set to its original size and left-aligned, it will hide the text right below it on the PDF export.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud
 * 800x420px PNG image (example attached - grey_image_resized.png)
 * Tested with this resolution but any image that covers a little less than the entire page will cause the issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a blank page and add the image, set it to *Original* size
 # Add some text at the right of the image
 # Select the image and *Align left*
 # Put the cursor before the text and use Shift+ENTER to move the text right under the image
 # Publish the page and export it to PDF

h3. Expected Results

The page should be exported with all images and texts
h3. Actual Results

The text below the image won't be shown:
 * Original page:
|!Screen Shot 2018-12-05 at 17.01.40.png|thumbnail!|

 * PDF export:
|!pdf_export.png|thumbnail!|

h3. Workaround

Use simple Enter instead of Shift+Enter to move the text
fields.summary: Image hides text on PDF export

fields.description: It is impossible to open Confluence Question page neither in email client nor in a browser, as Confluence Android automatically handles a deep link and shows the error screen.
fields.summary: Confluence Android handles a Confluence Question link but does not render the content.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In Confluence, when the user is going through the onboarding for the application, the same will be requested to create the first space. Once the space is created, the *Overview* page of the space will have an "Unknown User" watching it and if you try to remove it, the same will come back.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start a new Confluence application through the [option to try|https://www.atlassian.com/try/cloud/signup?bundle=confluence]
# Once the application is started, you will be redirected to the onboarding and will need to create the *first space*
# Once the space is created, go to the *Overview* page of the same and tap the little eye on the top right (watch option), then, *Manage Watchers*

h3. Expected Results
No user should be watching the page, and if so, the same should be able to be removed.

h3. Actual Results
An "Unknown User" is added as a watcher for the specific page and after being removed, if refreshing the page, the same will be kept there.

!unknown.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: First created space brings an "Unknown User" as a watcher

fields.description:
h3. Summary

User not able to add a label for attachment when they access space attachment page.


h3. Steps to replicate

# Create a page and add an attachment
# Go to space settings > content tools > attachments
# Click on pencil icon under the label to add a label

h3. Observed behavior

Not able to add the label

h3. Expected behavior

The user should be able to add the label


h3. Workaround

Need to go to each page attachment and add the label
* https://add yoursite URL/wiki/pages/viewpageattachments.action?pageId='add the page id'
fields.summary: Not able to add a label for attachment at space attachment page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Expand macro cuts off title text when the characters go more than 100 and when the macro is set to *Center*.


h3. How to replicate

# Create a blog and add expand macro with 101 characters
# Set the macro to *Center*
# Save the page

h3. Observed behavior

The 101 characters can't be seen on the blog.

h3. Expected behavior

It should display all the characters


h3. Workaround

Set the macro to *wide* or *full width*
fields.summary: Expand macro cuts off title text

fields.description:
h3. Summary
*Publishing* a page with *numbered column* shows +1 column number. It counts the header as *first* whereas in *edit mode* it displays correct numbering

h3. Environment
* Confluence cloud
* Pages
* Meeting notes


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a *table*
# Select *table settings* and check the option *Numbered column*

h3. Expected Results
It shouldn't count the header as first column


h3. Actual Results
It's counting *header* as it's first column
 
h3. Notes
In edit mode, we can see the count to be initiated excluding the header. However, after publishing the page it doesn't work to be expected
fields.summary: Table numbered column counts header as first column number

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a page has 1 like (from an authenticated user), anonymous users see "You like this", which is incorrect. Pages with more than a single like show the i18n key "likes.summary.you.you".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page that is accessible by an Anonymous user
# 1 Authenticated user should like the page 
# Another authenticated user should like the page
# Let an anonymous user access the page

h3. Expected Results
* It should display the correct number of likes.

h3. Actual Results
* When a page has 1 like (from an authenticated user), anonymous users see "You like this", which is incorrect. Pages with more than a single like show the i18n key "likes.summary.you.you".
fields.summary: Likes are broken for anonymous users
